page.title: 14HISTORY IN CANFORD MAGNA
page.content: {MERLEY HOUSE,a}fine 18th century(grade 1 listed) Georgian Mansion,was built in 1752 for RALPH WILLETT,who owned a large estate on St Christopher in the West Indies.It took 8 years to build.A library wing & picture gallery were built,& decorated with a sugar cane de sign,to acknowledge the source of Wil- letts wealth.RALPH WILLETT was married twice,but had no children.He died in 1795.In 1813 the books & paintings were sold.In 1875 the Willett family sold the estate to the Hambro banking family.In l966 when the house was in poor repair,it was bought by Mr Hamick & his 2 sons,who have converted it to holiday apartments.The original plast- er ceilings & Adam fireplaces remain. The gatehouse has been converted into Merley P.O.& Merlins Restaurant.The parish church is part Saxon,mainly Norman,with later additions.
